Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, which is deeply grooved in a number of places, is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn and faded in places, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.101)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87609) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87609)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 111 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
